intro: Agathosma hispida, commonly known as Cape lavender, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its gray-green, hairy foliage and small, purple-blue flowers. The plant is often found in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is valued for its aromatic properties and is used in traditional medicine. Agathosma hispida is also cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its hardy nature and aesthetic appeal.
